name: Aspen Street Inn

reviews.text: We just returned from a four night stay in the Campbird room at San Sophia Inn (Mar 5-9, 2006). Check-in was smooth, and though our luggage did not make it, we were assured by the manager that he would keep tabs on its arrival. We enjoyed the excellent happy hour, with nice choices of red and white wine and three kinds of micro brewed beers, with appetizers. The location of the Inn is superb; near the gondola, ski rental shop and town restaurants. The Campbird room was comfortable, a little cramped, but fine for a ski vacation. Having an area for ski and boot storage was a nice amenity. The gourmet breakfasts are excellent. Plenty of variety for all tastes, including delcious and interesting cold and hot items. The owners and managers are dedicated and engaging, which made for a positive experience. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: A very nice stay

reviews.text: This is the second time my wife and I have stayed here in recent years, and this stay was as great as the first one. The owners are still active in running the inn, and all of the staff were wonderful and very accomodating.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Our room had a queen size bed, as do most rooms, and was very nicely furnished and decorated. Everything was very clean, very quiet, and our room included cable TV and a VCR. Both our bed and pillows were very comfortable. The main floor of the inn has a very nice sitting area and a fireplace, and is stocked with magazines and daily newspaper.
reviews.title: Wonderful B & B!

reviews.text: A daily afternoon reception includes wines, beers, and a variety of snacks on the patio deck overlooking the mountains. Breakfast is served buffet style, and was the most extensive variety of items we have ever had. Items offered change daily and the morning we were there it included juices, fresh cut melons, cereals, french toast with a wonderful raspberry filling, sausage, eggs cooked to order, and several other items.
reviews.title: Film Festival Sanctuary
Nice Room
reviews.text: This inn is truly a gem, and we highly recommend it to anyone looking for a wonderful place to stay.

reviews.title: Fantastic !!!
reviews.text: I was diagnosed with pneumonia at the hospital in Cortez on the morning that we were to travel to Telluride. We called the San Sophia and they put a priority on preparation of our room so that we could check in early. The staff was very helpful and offered to assist in any way that they could. I missed much of Telluride, but greatly appreciated the San Sophia. Breakfast was exceptional. I wish we had been able to stay more than one night. I definitely plan to return. It is a fantastic place.

My wife and I loved staying here in August 2004 for our anniversary! Free parking in the garage and the location just off the main street in Telluride were great. The Silverpick Room was very clean and cutely furnished. We liked the friendly service and peaceful atmosphere. The B&B recommended a special anniversary dinner at 221 Oak St. - a superb restaurant/bistro only a block away. The included breakfast was superb - crepes, fritattas, and gourmet coffee were all a pleasant surprise!
reviews.title: Loved Staying Here!
a great choice
reviews.text: My wife and I and friends recently spent a week at the San Sophia.

reviews.title: Awesome Tour to view fall colors
reviews.text: Overall, it was one of the nicest b&b's we have stayed in during many years of travel. The owners went far out of their way to be helpful, accomodations were very comfortable, breakfasts were exceptional, and downtown location near restaurants and the gondola very convenient.

reviews.title: The Best Honeymoon
reviews.text: Fall scenery, with yellow and some orange aspens, was breathtaking.

description: The Aspen Street Inn is a charming 17 room Inn offering the perfect location in Telluride - 1 block from the gondola station (connecting the towns of Telluride and Mountain Village) and Main Street. Aspen Street Inn is convenient for skiers, shoppers and hikers alike - enjoy new bedding, a hot breakfast buffet (summer and winter seasons), wireless internet service, common dining/meeting area. Pet rooms are available.
